summary: This bill, the "Bonus Tax Relief for America's Seniors Act," proposes to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the additional standard deduction for seniors. It raises the deduction from $600 to $5,000, with provisions for inflation adjustments starting in 2027. The bill also includes conforming amendments to other sections of the code and specifies that the changes apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
